title: Kan Naoto | Japanese Prime Minister & Politician | Britannica

quotes: His political fortunes again rose when Hatoyama designated him his deputy prime minister in September 2009
and then named him finance minister in January 2010
As Hatoyama’s administration faltered in late May and then failed at the beginning of June
On June 4 he easily defeated a candidate backed by Ozawa to become party president
In mid-September 2010 Kan was reelected party leader, surviving a strong challenge by Ozawa
struck northern Honshu on March 11, 2011
Kan survived a no-confidence vote in the Diet in early June
Kan announced his resignation on August 26 as both head of the DPJ and as prime minister
Noda Yoshihiko, who had been finance minister in Kan’s cabinet, was elected party leader on August 29
and succeeded Kan as prime minister on August 30
Kan lost a reelection bid for his seat in the lower house in December 2012
prime minister (2010-2011)
